content.webTitle: Royal Mail worker kept 40,000 letters at home

fields.headline: Royal Mail worker kept 40,000 letters at home
fields.bodyText: A postman who hoarded 40,000 letters at home was found out when he recycled the undelivered mail by sending it, via three skips, to a recycling depot at Cwmtwrch, Swansea. Most of the unopened post had been destined for local addresses. Depot boss John Adams said: "It seems he started with junk mail, thinking it couldn't incriminate him, but as time ran out he began dumping people's post." The 55-year-old, who left his job a year ago, worked in a sorting office and covered for deliveries. He could face charges. The Royal Mail said it would deliver as much of the post as possible.
